ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: Allegheny Energy Supply Co. Market Rate Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text:
Version 5.0.0 Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC First Revised Market Rate Tariff
1. Availability. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC (“AE Supply”) makes electric energy and capacity available under this FERC electric tariff to any purchaser, except as prohibited below. Applicant also makes the following ancillary services available to any purchaser, except as prohibited below:
a. PJM: AE Supply offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10- minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. (“PJM”) and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection.
b. New York: AE Supply offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc.
c. New England: AE Supply offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10- minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England, Inc.
d. Third Party Provider: Third-party ancillary services: Regulation Service, Energy Imbalance Service, Spinning Reserves, and Supplemental Reserves. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third party provider, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of a public utility affiliated with the third party provider; and (3) sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers.
2. Applicability. This Market Rate Tariff is applicable to all sales of electric energy and/or capacity by AE Supply not otherwise subject to a specific rate schedule or tariff.
3. Rates. All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and AE Supply.
4. Other Terms and Conditions. All other terms and conditions of sale shall be established by agreement between Customer and AE Supply.
5. Compliance with Commission Regulations. AE Supply shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning AE Supply’s market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes AE Supply to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits AE Supply’s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning AE Supply’s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff.
6. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority. AE Supply has been granted the following waivers or exemptions in connection with its market- based rate authority: (i) waiver of Subparts B and C of Part 35 regarding the filing of rate schedules, except Sections 35.12(a), 35.12(b), 35.15 and 35.16; (ii) wavier of the accounting and related reporting requirements under Parts 41, 101 and 141 of the Commission’s regulations; and (iii) blanket authorization under Section 204 of the Federal Power Act, 16 U.S.C. § 824c, and Part 34 of the Commission’s regulations to issue securities and assume obligations and liability. See Allegheny Energy Supply Company, 88 FERC ¶ 61,303 (1999). AE Supply may sell available electric energy and/or capacity to Monongahela Power Company, The Potomac Edison Company, or West Penn Power Company (together “Franchised Affiliates”) under the terms of this Rate Schedule, provided that the hourly rate for each transaction shall not exceed the hourly market price index in dollars per megawatt-hour as posted on the PJM Homepage for transactions at the Allegheny Power/PJM transmission interface. See Allegheny Energy Supply Co., L.L.C., 91 FERC ¶ 61,255 (2000), reh’g granted, 96 FERC ¶ 61,002 (2001). Hourly rates for all such sales shall be calculated as follows: (a) hourly values shall be calculated from the shortest duration PJM posting available (whenever that duration is not an hour) by dividing the number of period hours into the posted price; and (b) AE Supply will multiply all hourly prices within a calendar month as determined above by the megawatt-hours actually sold to arrive at a total rate for the month for all transactions. See id.
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate Pennsylvania Electric Company (“Penelec”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Penelec: (1) four 5- month residential blocks and three 5-month commercial blocks, each for the term January 1, 2011 through May 31, 2011; (2) two 24-month residential blocks for the term June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2013; (3) three 12-month commercial blocks for the term June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2012; and (4) one 5 month commercial block for the term January 1, 2011 through May 31, 2011. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, 133 FERC ¶ 61,257 at P 5 & 15 (2010) (Docket No. ER10-1773-000).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sale to its affiliate the Potomac Edison Company (“Potomac Edison”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Potomac Edison: one 3-month bid block beginning March 1, 2011 to serve each block at 33.3 percent of Potomac Edison’s Type II Non-Residential SOS load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2817-000 at 1-2 (March 18, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the Potomac Edison Company (“Potomac Edison”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Potomac Edison: (1) one 24-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential Standard Offer Service (SOS) load; (2) one 12- month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential SOS load; and (3) one 24-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential SOS load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER10-2259-000 at 1-2 (January 4, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the West Penn Power Company (“West Penn”), pursuant to the terms of Provider of Last Resort Supply Master Agreements and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and West Penn: (1) one 17-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 3.33 percent of Type 10- Residential Load; (2) one 17 month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve nine percent of type 20-Non-Residential Load; and (3) two 12-month bid blocks beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 7.14 percent of Type 40-non-Residential Load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2110 at 1 (January 4, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the West Penn Power Company (“West Penn”), pursuant to the terms of a Provider of Last Resort Supply Master Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and West Penn (January 20, 2010): (1) one 17-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 3.33 percent of Type 10-Residential Load; (2) one 29-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 3.33 percent of Type 10-Residential Load; and (3) one 17 month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 11 percent of Type 30-non-Residential Load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2111 at 1-2 (January 4, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the West Penn Power Company (“West Penn”), pursuant to the terms of a Provider of Last Resort Supply Master Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and West Penn (May 19, 2010): (1) one 17-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 3.33 percent of Type 10-Residential Load; (2) one 29-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 3.33 percent of Type 10-Residential Load; (3) two 17-month bid blocks beginning January 1, 2011 to serve eight percent of Type 20-Non-Residential Load; (4) one 29-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve nine percent of Type 20- Non-Residential Load; and (5) two 17-month bid blocks beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 11 percent to Type 30-Non-Residential Load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2111 at 1-2 (January 4, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the Pennsylvania Electric Company (“Penelec”), pursuant to the terms of Default Service Supplier Master Agreements and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Penelec: three 5-month commercial blocks beginning January 1, 2011 through May 31, 2011; three 12-month commercial bid blocks beginning June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2012; and two 24-month residential bid blocks beginning June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2013. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2203 at 1 (January 25, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sale to its affiliate the Potomac Edison Company (“Potomac Edison”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Potomac Edison: one 3-month bid block beginning March 1, 2011 to serve each block at 33.3 percent of Potomac Edison’s Type II Non-Residential SOS load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2817-000 at 1-2 (March 18, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the Potomac Edison Company (“Potomac Edison”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Potomac Edison: (1) one 12-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential Standard Offer Service (SOS) load; and (2) one 24-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential SOS load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2633-000 at 1-2 (March 18, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the Potomac Edison Company (“Potomac Edison”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Potomac Edison: (1) one 12-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential SOS load; and (2) one 24-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential SOS load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2817-000 at 1-2 (March 18, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate Pennsylvania Electric Company (“Penelec”), pursuant to the terms of a Default Service Supplier Master Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Penelec: (1) two 12-month residential blocks beginning June 1, 2011; (2) one 24-month residential blocks beginning June 1, 2011; and (3) three 12-month commercial blocks beginning June 1, 2011. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2874-000 at 1 (May 13, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliates The Cleveland Electric Illuminating Company, The Toledo Edison Company, and Ohio Edison Company (collectively, the “FirstEnergy Ohio Companies”), pursuant to the terms of a Master Standard Service Offer Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and the FirstEnergy Ohio Companies: (1) four 12-month blocks for the term June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2012; (2) four 24-month blocks for the term June 1, 2011 through May 31 2013; and (3) four 36-month blocks for the term June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2014.. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, 135 FERC ¶ 61,199 at P 1 and 25 (2011) (Docket No. ER11-2942-000).
7. Seller is a Category 2 seller, as defined in 18 CFR § 35.36(a), in the Northeast region (as defined in FERC Order Nos. 697 and 697-A), and is a Category 1 seller, as defined in all other regions.
8. Effective Date. This Market Rate Tariff is effective as of September 18, 2007.
record_data.filing_title: Revisions to Market-Based Rate Tariff of AE Supply

record_data.record_plain_text:
Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC Second Revised Market Rate Tariff
1. Availability. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC (“AE Supply”) makes electric energy and capacity available under this FERC electric tariff to any purchaser, except as prohibited below. Applicant also makes the following ancillary services available to any purchaser, except as prohibited below:
a. PJM: AE Supply offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10- minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. (“PJM”) and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection.
b. New York: AE Supply offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc.
c. New England: AE Supply offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10- minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England, Inc.
d. Third Party Provider: Third-party ancillary services: Regulation Service, Energy Imbalance Service, Spinning Reserves, and Supplemental Reserves. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third party provider, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of a public utility affiliated with the third party provider; and (3) sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers.
2. Applicability. This Market Rate Tariff is applicable to all sales of electric energy and/or capacity by AE Supply not otherwise subject to a specific rate schedule or tariff.
3. Rates. All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and AE Supply.
4. Other Terms and Conditions. All other terms and conditions of sale shall be established by agreement between Customer and AE Supply.
5. Compliance with Commission Regulations. AE Supply shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning AE Supply’s market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes AE Supply to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits AE Supply’s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning AE Supply’s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff.
6. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority. AE Supply has been granted the following waivers or exemptions in connection with its market- based rate authority: (i) waiver of Subparts B and C of Part 35 regarding the filing of rate schedules, except Sections 35.12(a), 35.12(b), 35.15 and 35.16; (ii) wavier of the accounting and related reporting requirements under Parts 41, 101 and 141 of the Commission’s regulations; and (iii) blanket authorization under Section 204 of the Federal Power Act, 16 U.S.C. § 824c, and Part 34 of the Commission’s regulations to issue securities and assume obligations and liability. See Allegheny Energy Supply Company, 88 FERC ¶ 61,303 (1999). In addition, AE Supply has been granted the following waiver in connection with its market-based rate authority: waiver of the separation of functions requirements of Section 35.39(c)(2)(i) of the Commission’s regulations (18 C.F.R. § 35.39(c)(2)(i)) to permit FirstEnergy Service Company employees to prepare and submit offers into the PJM Reliability Pricing Model capacity auctions for both Monongahela Power Company and AE Supply’s entitlements to Ohio Valley Electric Corporation capacity. See FirstEnergy Serv. Co., 181 FERC ¶ 61,201 (2022). AE Supply may sell available electric energy and/or capacity to Monongahela Power Company, The Potomac Edison Company, or West Penn Power Company (together “Franchised Affiliates”) under the terms of this Rate Schedule, provided that the hourly rate for each transaction shall not exceed the hourly market price index in dollars per megawatt-hour as posted on the PJM Homepage for transactions at the Allegheny Power/PJM transmission interface. See Allegheny Energy Supply Co., L.L.C., 91 FERC ¶ 61,255 (2000), reh’g granted, 96 FERC ¶ 61,002 (2001). Hourly rates for all such sales shall be calculated as follows: (a) hourly values shall be calculated from the shortest duration PJM posting available (whenever that duration is not an hour) by dividing the number of period hours into the posted price; and (b) AE Supply will multiply all hourly prices within a calendar month as determined above by the megawatt-hours actually sold to arrive at a total rate for the month for all transactions. See id.
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate Pennsylvania Electric Company (“Penelec”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Penelec: (1) four 5- month residential blocks and three 5-month commercial blocks, each for the term January 1, 2011 through May 31, 2011; (2) two 24-month residential blocks for the term June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2013; (3) three 12-month commercial blocks for the term June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2012; and (4) one 5 month commercial block for the term January 1, 2011 through May 31, 2011. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, 133 FERC ¶ 61,257 at P 5 & 15 (2010) (Docket No. ER10-1773-000).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sale to its affiliate the Potomac Edison Company (“Potomac Edison”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Potomac Edison: one 3-month bid block beginning March 1, 2011 to serve each block at 33.3 percent of Potomac Edison’s Type II Non-Residential SOS load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2817-000 at 1-2 (March 18, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the Potomac Edison Company (“Potomac Edison”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Potomac Edison: (1) one 24-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential Standard Offer Service (SOS) load; (2) one 12- month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential SOS load; and (3) one 24-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential SOS load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER10-2259-000 at 1-2 (January 4, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the West Penn Power Company (“West Penn”), pursuant to the terms of Provider of Last Resort Supply Master Agreements and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and West Penn: (1) one 17-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 3.33 percent of Type 10- Residential Load; (2) one 17 month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve nine percent of type 20-Non-Residential Load; and (3) two 12-month bid blocks beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 7.14 percent of Type 40-non-Residential Load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2110 at 1 (January 4, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the West Penn Power Company (“West Penn”), pursuant to the terms of a Provider of Last Resort Supply Master Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and West Penn (January 20, 2010): (1) one 17-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 3.33 percent of Type 10-Residential Load; (2) one 29-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 3.33 percent of Type 10-Residential Load; and (3) one 17 month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 11 percent of Type 30-non-Residential Load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2111 at 1-2 (January 4, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the West Penn Power Company (“West Penn”), pursuant to the terms of a Provider of Last Resort Supply Master Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and West Penn (May 19, 2010): (1) one 17-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 3.33 percent of Type 10-Residential Load; (2) one 29-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 3.33 percent of Type 10-Residential Load; (3) two 17-month bid blocks beginning January 1, 2011 to serve eight percent of Type 20-Non-Residential Load; (4) one 29-month bid block beginning January 1, 2011 to serve nine percent of Type 20- Non-Residential Load; and (5) two 17-month bid blocks beginning January 1, 2011 to serve 11 percent to Type 30-Non-Residential Load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2111 at 1-2 (January 4, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the Pennsylvania Electric Company (“Penelec”), pursuant to the terms of Default Service Supplier Master Agreements and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Penelec: three 5-month commercial blocks beginning January 1, 2011 through May 31, 2011; three 12-month commercial bid blocks beginning June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2012; and two 24-month residential bid blocks beginning June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2013. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2203 at 1 (January 25, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sale to its affiliate the Potomac Edison Company (“Potomac Edison”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Potomac Edison: one 3-month bid block beginning March 1, 2011 to serve each block at 33.3 percent of Potomac Edison’s Type II Non-Residential SOS load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2817-000 at 1-2 (March 18, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the Potomac Edison Company (“Potomac Edison”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Potomac Edison: (1) one 12-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential Standard Offer Service (SOS) load; and (2) one 24-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential SOS load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2633-000 at 1-2 (March 18, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate the Potomac Edison Company (“Potomac Edison”), pursuant to the terms of a Full Requirements Service Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Potomac Edison: (1) one 12-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential SOS load; and (2) one 24-month bid block beginning June 1, 2011 to serve one block at 6.7 percent of Potomac Edison’s Residential SOS load. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2817-000 at 1-2 (March 18, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliate Pennsylvania Electric Company (“Penelec”), pursuant to the terms of a Default Service Supplier Master Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and Penelec: (1) two 12-month residential blocks beginning June 1, 2011; (2) one 24-month residential blocks beginning June 1, 2011; and (3) three 12-month commercial blocks beginning June 1, 2011. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, Docket No. ER11-2874-000 at 1 (May 13, 2011) (unpublished letter order).
AE Supply is authorized to make the following power sales to its affiliates The Cleveland Electric Illuminating Company, The Toledo Edison Company, and Ohio Edison Company (collectively, the “FirstEnergy Ohio Companies”), pursuant to the terms of a Master Standard Service Offer Agreement and transaction confirmations between AE Supply and the FirstEnergy Ohio Companies: (1) four 12-month blocks for the term June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2012; (2) four 24-month blocks for the term June 1, 2011 through May 31 2013; and (3) four 36-month blocks for the term June 1, 2011 through May 31, 2014.. Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC, 135 FERC ¶ 61,199 at P 1 and 25 (2011) (Docket No. ER11-2942-000).
7. Seller is a Category 2 seller, as defined in 18 CFR § 35.36(a), in the Northeast region (as defined in FERC Order Nos. 697 and 697-A), and is a Category 1 seller, as defined in all other regions.
8. Effective Date. This Market Rate Tariff is effective as of September 18, 2007.
record_data.filing_title: Compliance Filing re Waiver of Affiliate Rules of AE Supply
